Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, reports, memoranda, and printed matter, relating to American economic conditions, American economic policy, especially during the presidential administrations of Dwight D. Eisenhower and Richard M. Nixon, and especially to banking and taxation issues.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Charls E. Walker Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2001.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Instructor of finance, University of Pennsylvania
Instructor, Assistant Professor, and Associate Professor of finance, University of Texas
Financial economist at the Federal Reserve Bank, Pennsylvania
Financial economist at the Federal Reserve Bank, Dallas
Ph.D. in economics, Wharton School of Finance, University of Pennsylvania
Assistant to the Secretary of the Treasury Robert B. Anderson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Charls E. Walker papers consist of material related to Charls E. Walker's professional life in business and government. They include biographical material, correspondence, memoranda, speeches, writings, and printed matter reflecting his long career in banking, and his tenure as Under Secretary (1969-1973) and Deputy Secretary of the Treasury (1973).

Of particular interest is material related to his career in the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas, and his close relationship to the business and academic community of Texas, reflected in numerous appearances and speeches before academic and business groups, found in the SPEECHES AND WRITINGS series. The collection also includes extensive material about American banking, including the American Banking Association.

The TREASURY DEARTMENT OFFICE FILE contains material related to his tenure in the Treasury Department, including briefings, memoranda, reports, speeches, and writings. An extensive SUBJECT FILE includes material about business associations, and groups such as the American Economic Association, as well as business and the U.S. economy. The collection also includes writings by other economists and political figures.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.subject: Finance, Public--United States.
Banks and banking--United States.
Taxation--United States.
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Dept. of the Treasury.

scopecontent.p: Appointments, clippings about Charls E. Walker, letters, press releases, and telephone call sheets. Arranged alphabetically by physical form
Correspondence of Charls E. Walker with business associates and organizations, and government offices and officials, including the White House. Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent
Articles, lectures, speeches, transcripts of press conferences, television and radio interviews, and thesis for Ph.D. degree. Arranged chronologically by title
Writings by individuals in business and government related to Charls E. Walker's activities. Mostly related to business and economics. Arranged alphabetically by name of author
Correspondence, memoranda, reports, and writings related to banking and especially the Federal Reserve System. Arranged by subject

did.unittitle: Office File of the United States Department of the Treasury, 1961-1972.

scopecontent.p: Briefings, memoranda, printed matter, public statements, and reports generated by or related to the Treasury Department. Arranged alphabetically by physical form
Catalogs, correspondence, memoranda, printed matter, and reports, mostly related to business, economics, and politics. Arranged alphabetically by subject
Articles on economics, catalogs of books about economics, and clippings related to business, economics, and politics. Arranged alphabetically by physical form
5 prints, including 1 print of Ronald Reagan and 1 print of James Brady

did.unittitle: Letters received upon resignation from the Department of the Treasury. Mostly from members of Congress and the administration, 1973

scopecontent.p: Includes memoranda for members of the presidential staff

did.unittitle: Correspondence and printed matter related to speeches delivered

scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper clippings re Fred Florence
